1.name: Sahara
1.description: After the fall of Tobruk in 1942, during the Allied retreat in the Libyan desert, an American tank picks-up a motley group of survivors but they face advancing Germans and a lack of water.

2.name: Jane Eyre
2.description: After a harsh childhood, orphan Jane Eyre is hired by Edward Rochester, the brooding lord of a mysterious manor house, to care for his young daughter.

3.name: The Outlaw
3.description: Western legends Pat Garrett, Doc Holliday and Billy the Kid are played against each other over the law and the attentions of vivacious country vixen Rio McDonald.

4.name: Shadow of a Doubt
4.description: A young woman discovers her visiting uncle may not be the man he seems to be.

5.name: Batman
5.description: Japanese spymaster Prince Daka operates a covert espionage organization located in Gotham City's now-deserted Little Tokyo which turns American scientists into pliable zombies.

6.name: The Ox-Bow Incident
6.description: When a posse captures three men suspected of killing a local farmer, they become strongly divided over whether or not to lynch the men.

7.name: For Whom the Bell Tolls
7.description: During the Spanish Civil War, an American allied with the Republicans finds romance during a desperate mission to blow up a strategically important bridge.

8.name: My Friend Flicka
8.description: Ken McLaughlin struggles to please his family in any way. He comes back from boarding school boasting poor grades and facing going through the fifth grade again, much to his fathers dismay....                See full summary »

9.name: The Gentle Sex
9.description: This film tells the stories of seven 'gentle' British girls who decide to "do their bit" and help out during World War II.

10.name: Heaven Can Wait
10.description: An old roué arrives in Hades to review his life with Satan, who will rule on his eligibility to enter the Underworld.

11.name: Sagebrush Law
11.description: Tom Weston arriving in town just as the Doctor announces his father's death a suicide, sees the gun is in the wrong hand. When the Bank Examiner announces the bank has no money and Tom's ...                See full summary »

12.name: The Song of Bernadette
12.description: In 1858 France, Bernadette, an adolescent peasant girl, has a vision of "a beautiful lady" in the city dump. She never claims it to be anything other than this, but the townspeople all ...                See full summary »

13.name: Bar 20
13.description: Stagecoach robbers take the money Hoppy was going to use to buy cattle so Hoppy, California and Lin go after them.

14.name: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
14.description: From the Boer War through World War II, a soldier rises through the ranks in the British military.

15.name: Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man
15.description: After being awakened, Larry Talbot chips Frankenstein's Monster out of a block of ice. When Talbot changes to the Wolf Man, the two creatures battle each other.

16.name: I Walked with a Zombie
16.description: A Canadian nurse is hired to care for the wife of a sugar plantation owner, who has been acting strangely, on a Caribbean island.

17.name: Phantom of the Opera
17.description: A disfigured violinist haunts the Paris Opera House.

18.name: Ossessione
18.description: Gino, a drifter, begins an affair with inn-owner Giovanna as they plan to get rid of her older husband.

19.name: The More the Merrier
19.description: During the World War II housing shortage in Washington, two men and a woman share a single apartment and the older man plays Cupid to the other two.

20.name: Get Cracking
20.description: George Formby joins the home guard.

21.name: Stormy Weather
21.description: The relationship between an aspiring dancer and a popular songstress provides a retrospective of the great African American entertainers of the early 1900s.

22.name: Destination Tokyo
22.description: In order to provide information for the first air raid over Tokyo, a U.S. submarine sneaks into Tokyo Bay and places a spy team ashore.

23.name: Cabin in the Sky
23.description: A compulsive gambler dies during a shooting, but he'll receive a second chance to reform himself and to make up with his worried wife.

24.name: The Desert Song
24.description: Paul Hudson, leads a group of desert bandits against some Nazis, who want to use them as cheap labor for their railroad.

25.name: Lassie Come Home
25.description: After her destitute family is forced to sell her, a collie named Lassie escapes from her new owner and begins the long trek from Scotland to her Yorkshire home.

26.name: The Seventh Victim
26.description: A woman in search of her missing sister uncovers a Satanic cult in New York's Greenwich Village, and finds that they may have something to do with her sibling's random disappearance.

27.name: Crash Dive
27.description: A submarine lieutenant and his commander fall in love with the same girl.

28.name: Thousands Cheer
28.description: Acrobat Eddie Marsh is in the army now. His first act is to become friendly with Kathryn Jones, the colonel's pretty daughter. Their romance hits a few snags, including disapproval from her...                See full summary »

29.name: Vredens dag
29.description: The young wife of an aging priest falls in love with his son amidst the horror of a merciless witch hunt in 17th century Denmark.

30.name: Edge of Darkness
30.description: After two years under German rule, a small Norwegian fishing village rises up and revolts against the occupying Nazis.

31.name: Son of Dracula
31.description: Count Alucard finds his way from Budapest to the swamps of the Deep South; his four nemeses are a medical doctor, a university professor, a jilted fiancé and the woman he loves.

32.name: Action in the North Atlantic
32.description: An American tanker is sunk by a German U-boat and the survivors spend eleven days at sea on a raft. They're next assigned to the liberty ship "Sea Witch" bound for Murmansk through the sub-stalked North Atlantic.

33.name: Watch on the Rhine
33.description: A German-born engineer, his American wife and their children travel from Mexico to the United States to visit her family but their plans are complicated by a Romanian count.

34.name: The North Star
34.description: A Ukrainian village must suddenly contend with the Nazi invasion of June 1941.

35.name: A Guy Named Joe
35.description: A dead World War II bomber pilot named Pete Sandidge, becomes the guardian angel of another pilot, Ted Randall. He guides Ted through battle and helping him to romance his old girlfriend, despite her excessive devotion to Sandidge's memory.

36.name: Five Graves to Cairo
36.description: During World War II, an undercover British soldier tries get word to the Allies that the Germans have tons of supplies buried in five excavations across Egypt.

37.name: In Old Oklahoma
37.description: In 1906, on Oklahoma's Indian lands, a cowboy fights for oil lease rights against a greedy oilman while a pretty schoolteacher steals both men's hearts.

38.name: Hangmen Also Die!
38.description: After the Nazi administrator of Czechoslovakia is shot, his assassin tries to elude the Gestapo and struggles with his impulse to give himself up as hostages are executed.

39.name: Le corbeau
39.description: French village doctor becomes target of poison-pen letters sent to village leaders, accusing him of affairs and practicing abortion.

40.name: Bataan
40.description: In 1942, in the Bataan peninsula of the Philippines, a ragtag American unit commanded by Sergeant Bill Dane attempts to blow-up a bridge in order to slow the Japanese advance.

41.name: Lady of Burlesque
41.description: After one member of their group is murdered, the performers at a burlesque house must work together to find out who the killer is before they strike again.

42.name: We'll Meet Again
42.description: A young dancer trying to make it in London during World War II discovers that people like her singing voice, too. Although she's at first reluctant to sing, she finally does and becomes a ...                See full summary »

43.name: Air Raid Wardens
43.description: Two bumblers, failures as businessmen and air raid wardens, stumble across a nest of Nazi saboteurs bent on blowing up the local magnesium plant.

44.name: Sherlock Holmes Faces Death
44.description: During WWII several murders occur at a convalescent home where Dr. Watson has volunteered his services. He summons Holmes for help and the master detective proceeds to solve the crime from ...                See full summary »

45.name: Journey Into Fear
45.description: An American ballistics expert in Turkey finds himself targeted by Nazi agents. Safe passage home by ship is arranged for him, but he soon discovers that his pursuers are also on board.

46.name: O noapte furtunoasa
46.description: Bucharest, 1876. Don Dumitrache instructs his trusted man, Chiriac, to watch his young wife, Veta. Dumitrache is sure that Veta having an affair, she does not know is that her lover is Chiriac own...

47.name: So Proudly We Hail!
47.description: A group of nurses returning from the war in the Phillippines recall their experiences in combat and in love.

48.name: The Spider Woman
48.description: Sherlock Holmes investigates a series of so-called "pajama suicides". He knows the female villain behind them is as cunning as Moriarty and as venomous as a spider.

49.name: Du Barry Was a Lady
49.description: A night club's coatroom attendant who's in-love with the club's singer accidentally sips a drugged drink that makes him dream he's French King Louis XV courting the infamous Madame Du Barry.

50.name: Münchhausen
50.description: This lavish, impudent, adult fairy tale takes the viewer from 18th-century Braunschweig to St. Petersburg, Constantinople, Venice, and then to the moon using ingenious special effects, stunning location shooting.
